block.p: An guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
BLAIR ACADEMY -- Tom Chapin and Friends concert. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $9. DuBois Theater, Blairstown. (908) 362-6121, extension 5612.

CAPE MAY CONVENTION HALL -- Cape May Music Festival. Through June 25. Cape May Festival Orchestra, featuring Charles Tomlinson and David Murray, contrabass soloists. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 for each concert; $10 for older people; $5 for students. Beach Drive and Stockton Street, Cape May. The New York Chamber Ensemble, featuring Joseph Deninzon, jazz violinist, and Jon Klibonoff, pianist. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. New Jersey Symphony Chamber Players present an evening of masterpieces of the string repertory. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Episcopal Church of the Advent. Washington and Franklin Streets, Cape Map.(609) 884-5404.

An guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
BLAIR ACADEMY -- Tom Chapin and Friends concert. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $9. DuBois Theater, Blairstown. (908) 362-6121, extension 5612.

CAPE MAY CONVENTION HALL -- Cape May Music Festival. Through June 25. Cape May Festival Orchestra, featuring Charles Tomlinson and David Murray, contrabass soloists. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20 for each concert; $10 for older people; $5 for students. Beach Drive and Stockton Street, Cape May. The New York Chamber Ensemble, featuring Joseph Deninzon, jazz violinist, and Jon Klibonoff, pianist. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. New Jersey Symphony Chamber Players present an evening of masterpieces of the string repertory. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Episcopal Church of the Advent. Washington and Franklin Streets, Cape Map.(609) 884-5404.
CONTINENTAL AIRLINES ARENA -- Tina Turner with Lionel Richie, special guest. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $45.25 to $150.25. 50 Route 120, East Rutherford. (201) 935-3900.

THE CORNERSTONE -- Victor Lin Trio. Wednesday, 7:30 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. Keith Saunders Quartet. Friday, 9 p.m. to 1 a.m. Sarah Partridge Quartet. Saturday, 9 p.m. to 1 a.m. 25 New Street, Metuchen. (732) 549-5306.
FIRST PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH -- ''United We Sing,'' concert offered by the Arcadian Chorale. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Route 34 and Franklin Street, Matawan. (732) 583-7874.
FIRST PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH -- Calvin and Chapel Handbell Ringers concert. Today at 7 p.m. Freewill offering. 255 Harding Road, Red Bank. (732) 747-1329.
FREE PUBLIC LIBRARY OF ELIZABETH -- James. L. Dean Quintet, swing music. Saturday at 2:15 p.m. 11 South Broad Street, Elizabeth. (908) 354-6060.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS -- JVC Jazz Festival. ''New World Sinfonia,'' with Al Di Meola, guitarist. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $38 and $28. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES -- ''Songs and Psalms for the Ages,'' Shirah's Spring Concert. Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for members; $7.50 for students and older people. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900.
J. C. C. THURNAUER SCHOOL OF MUSIC -- First Annual Founder's Day Concert. Thursday at 7 p.m. Donations accepted. Taub Auditorium, 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 235.
JOE'S MILL HILL SALOON -- Divine Afflatus. Friday at 9 p.m. Wilbo Wright. Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Broad and Market Streets, Trenton. (609) 394-7222.

MAXWELL'S -- Vic Thrill and John Faye Powertrip. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $10. Freedy Johnston and Julia Greenberg. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $10. Cropduster, Every Damn Day and the New Mexicans. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $6. 1039 Washington Street, Hoboken. (201) 653-1703.
MINSTREL COFFEEHOUSE -- Hugh Blumenfeld and the Uncalled 4. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $5. Morris County Park Commission's Cultural Center, 300 Mendham Road, Morristown. (973) 335-9489.

MOONROCK BAR AND GRILL -- Reggae with Jah Works. Friday at 10 p.m. Virginia and Michael Ferentino, with Billy Latshaw, special guest. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $5. 201 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 897-1020.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER -- Young Newark musicians' finale of Jazz Residency program to give jazz performance. Tuesday at noon. Free. ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings through Aug. 31. Companhia das Musicas, Portugese folk music; the Salt Brothers, soul and funk; Treva Offut, blues and jazz; Jose de Carmen Y Su Bachata Romantica, Dominican music. Thursday, 5 p.m. to 10 p.m. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

OUTPOST IN THE BURBS -- ''Farewell for the Summer Concert'' featuring Holly Near, with Peter Spink, special guest. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $14 (advance); $16 (day of show). 40 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair. (973) 744-6560.
PARAMOUNT THEATER -- Ratdog. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $30. Ocean Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 918-6676.

PNC BANK ARTS CENTER -- Steve Miller Band. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20.50 to $45. The Cure. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25.50 to $47.50. Poison. Saturday at 6 p.m. Tickets: $17.50 to $29.50. 311. Next Sunday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25. Exit 116, off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. (201) 507-8900.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM -- LaShir, Moshe Budmor, artistic director, with Georgiana Rosca, pianist. Works of Rossi, and music in Hebrew, Yiddish and Ladino. Today at 2:30 p.m. Free. 2000 Princeton University Summer Concerts series, featuring Miro String Quartet. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Free. ''An Amazing a Capella Amalgamation.'' Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $18. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.
SIX FLAGS GREAT ADVENTURE -- Billy Ray Cyrus. Saturday at 8 p.m. Free with admission. Northern Star Arena, exit 7A off the New Jersey Turnpike. (732) 928-2000.
ST. JOHN'S CHURCH -- ''Aeros,'' a woodwind quintet concert performed by the Music Maestro Please Free Community Concert Series. Free. 215 Lafayette Avenue, Passaic. (973) 779-0966.

STANHOPE HOUSE -- Jiggle the Handle. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $8. Todd Wolfe Blues Project, blues and rock. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $7. Black Widow Blues Band. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $7. 45 Main Street, Stanhope. (973) 347-0458.
THEATER

BANANAS COMEDY CLUB -- Claudia Sherman, with Greg Vaccariello and Laurie Alberry. Friday at 9:30 p.m.; Saturday at 8:30 p.m. and 10:45 p.m. Tickets: $10 on Friday; $12 on Saturday.Holiday Inn, 283 Route 17 South, Hasbrouck Heights. (201) 727-1090.

BENJAMIN FRANKLIN MIDDLE SCHOOL -- The Ridgewood Gilbert and Sullivan Opera Company will present ''The Yeomen of the Guard.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for older people; $10 youth (ages 12 to 18 years); free for children under 12. 335 North Van Dien Avenue, Ridgewood. (973) 423-0300.
BICKFORD THEATER -- The Odd Couple. Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25; $23 for older people; $22 for students. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-8069.
CHESTER THEATER GROUP -- ''Collected Stories,'' by Donald Marguiles. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Black River Playhouse, Grove Street, Chester. (908) 879-7304.
DOVER LITTLE THEATER -- Gilbert and Sullivan's ''Pirates of Penzance.'' Through June 24. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16. Elliot Street, Dover. (973) 328-9202.

EL BODEGON RESTAURANT -- Carnival Productions presents, ''Joined at the Head,'' Catherine Butterfield's seriocomic drama. Today and next Sunday at 2:30 p.m.; Thursday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; $10 for students and older people. 169 West Main Street, Rahway. (732) 388-0647.

GEORGE STREET PLAYHOUSE -- The Next Stage Festival. ''Second Chance.'' Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $10. ''Looking East,'' performed by Randy James Dance Works. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students, children and older people. Saturday night benefit performance: $25 to $100. 9 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7717.
HELEN HAYES PERFORMING ARTS CENTER -- ''Mame,'' musical. Saturday through July 9. $25 to $42.50. 117 Main Street, Nyack, N.Y. (914) 358-6333.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE -- ''Mary, Mary,'' Jean Kerr's comedy. Through June 30. Monday through Saturday luncheon performances at 11 a.m., $35.50 and $39.50; Saturdays at 6:30 p.m., $43 and $47; Sundays at 3:30 p.m., $41.50 and $45.50. Reservations required. Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.

KEAN COLLEGE -- Alliance Repertory presents ''Dancing at Lughnasa,'' Brian Friel's Irish play. Through June 24. Thursday, Friday and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students and older people. Little Theater, 1000 Morris Avenue, Union. (908) 527-2000 or (908) 756-7824.

McCARTER THEATER -- Opera Festival of New Jersey. Through July 23. ''Carmen.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Wednesday, June 21 at 7:30 p.m.; Friday, June 23 at 8 p.m.; Sunday, June 25 at 2 p.m.; Saturday, July 1 at 8 p.m.; Saturday, July 8 at 8 p.m.; Friday, July 14 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $82. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MILL HILL PLAYHOUSE -- Passage Theater Company presents ''Blinding Light,'' by William Mastrosimone. Through June 25. Thursdays at 5:30 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Saturday and Sunday matinees at 3 p.m. Tickets: $17.50 for Thursdays and $20 for all other performances. Front and Montgomery Streets, Trenton. (609) 392-0766.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY -- TheaterFest, the Professional Equity Theatre-in-Residence. Through August. Patti LuPone in ''Matters of the Heart.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $45. ''Master Class,'' starring Leslie Uggams. Thursday through June 25. Tickets: $35; $28 for older people. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.

MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY -- ''Don't Dress for Dinner,'' Marc Camoletti's comedic play. Today and Wednesday through next Sunday. Tickets: $9, $12 and $15.Lauren K. Woods Theater, Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch. (732) 571-3483.

MURDER TO GO THEATER -- ''Killing Mr. Withers.'' Ongoing. Fridays and Saturdays at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $45 on Fridays; $48 on Saturdays, includes four-course dinner. Il Giardino, Cedar Knolls. (973) 301-0562.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER -- The Who's ''Tommy.'' Tuesday through next Sunday. Tuesday through Thursday at 7:30 p.m.; Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $58. Prudential Hall. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

NEW JERSEY REPERTORY COMPANY -- ''Octet,'' Mark Dunn comic-drama. Through next Sunday. Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25. Lumia Theater, 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- ''The Forest,'' by Alexander Ostrovsky, Russian playwright. Tuesday through July 2. Tuesday and Wednesday at 8 p.m. (previews); Thursday at 7:30 p.m.; Saturday at 7 p.m. (opening night); next Sunday at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES -- Through Sept. 9. ''The Pirates of Penzance,'' performed by Albert Bergeret with New York's Gilbert and Sullivan Players. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 (reserved); $20 (regular admission). The Great Auditorium, two blocks from the ocean at the intersection of Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.

OPEN AIR THEATER -- Shakespeare's ''Henry IV, Part One.'' Thursday, Friday and Saturday performances at 8 p.m. Tickets: $7.50 on Thursday and Friday; $9 on Saturday. Washington Crossing State Park, Titusville. (609) 882-5979.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE -- ''Pippin.'' Through July 23. Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 p.m.; Thursday and Sunday matinees at 2 p.m.; Saturday matinees at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $36 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY -- ''Carousel.'' Through June 24. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees next Sunday and June 18 at 2 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children 12 and under. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.
RITZ THEATER -- ''Not Necessarily for Kids,'' with Joey Quaile and the Quaile Family. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12.50. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (609) 858-5230.

STUDIO PLAYHOUSE -- ''Down Memory Lane,'' a look at the composers and lyricists of Tin Pan Alley. Today at 5 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. 14 Alvin Place, Upper Montclair. (973) 744-9752.

TRI-STATE ACTORS THEATER -- ''All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten,'' a musical based on the books by Robert Fulghum. Through next Sunday. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; today and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15 for Friday and Saturday; $13 for Sunday matinees; $11 for students and older people. Garris Center Theater, Broad Street, Branchville. (888) 840-7889.
VILLAGERS THEATER -- ''West Side Story.'' Through June 24. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15. 475 DeMott Lane, Somerset. (732) 873-2710.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER -- Fran Capo, humor writer and performer. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. 18 Sterling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

ABC GALLERY -- ''Nature's Mysteries, Oils by Edith Skiba.'' Through July 1. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lambertville Public Library, 6 Lilly Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-0275.

AFRICAN ART MUSEUM OF THE S.M.A. FATHERS -- ''Eloquent Threads: The Language of African Costumes and Textiles.'' Through Dec. 31. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 23 Bliss Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 894-8611.

AMERICAN LABOR MUSEUM -- ''Vital Vestiges,'' a photodocumentary of the Paterson historic district's ruins. ''What is Industrial Hygiene?'' photo and illustration exhibit on loan from the American Industrial Hygiene Association in Virginia. Through June 25. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. Botto House National Landmark, 83 Norwood Street, Haledon. (973) 595-7953.

ATLANTIC CAPE COMMUNITY COLLEGE -- Sally Erskine, one-person show of paintings and prints. Tuesday through Aug. 18. Call for gallery times. Art Gallery, 5100 Black Horse Pike, May Landing. (609) 343-5040.

ATRIUM ART GALLERY -- ''Five Views,'' featuring landscape photography. Through July 21. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Morris County Administration and Records Building, Morristown. (973) 285-6120.
BARRON ARTS CENTER -- Dolores D'Achille, art exhibit. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.
BERLEX LABORATORIES CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS -- ''Beauty: Outside and Inside,'' by Bertha E. Barmakian. Through Sept. 6. By appointment. 340 Changebridge Road, Montville. (973) 276-2000.
BERNARDSVILLE PUBLIC LIBRARY -- ''Stories in Paint -- People and Places Around the World,'' paintings by Cinder LeDell. Through June. 1 Anderson Hill Road, Bernardsville. (908) 766-0118.

BRION GALLERIES -- ''New Work by Oil Painter Cathy Lang.'' Through June 25. ''Alien Beings of Uncertain Origin,'' one-man show of monotypes by Stephen McKenzie. Through Aug. 27. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 1293 Route 179, Lambertville. (609) 397-7030.

BRISTOL-MYERS SQUIBB GALLERY -- ''Fragile Dependencies: A Close Look at Delicate Relationships in Nature.'' Wednesday through Sept. 10 Opening reception: Wednesday, 4:30 p.m. to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Route 206, Lawrenceville, three miles south of Princeton. (609) 252-6275.

CERULEAN FINE ARTS GALLERY -- ''New Works,'' a summer membership show, with paintings in all media, sculpture and photography. Tuesday through Sept. 2. Opening reception: Saturday, 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 4 to 9 p.m. Headquarters Plaza Mall, Speedwell Avenue (Route 202), Morristown. (973) 267-3730.
CHALFONTE HOTEL -- ''Barbara Cox: Watercolor Exhibit.'' Through June. Opening reception: Today, 2 to 4 p.m. Free. The Magnolia Room, 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.

CHAMOT GALLERY -- ''The Shape of Things That Are,'' distinctive sculptures by Lawrence Fane and Christopher Whittey. Through July 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. 111 First Street, Jersey City. (201) 610-1468.

CIVILIAN -- ''Val Sivilli: Paintings.'' Through July 15. Hours: Mondays and Wednesdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 10 Bridge Street, Frenchtown. (908) 996-7279.

COOPER GALLERY -- ''The Illuminated Woman,'' a solo exhibition of paintings and drawings by Eileen Kennedy-Dyne. Through July 1. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 7 p.m. 295 Grove Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-1074.

DIVIANA -- ''Whimsy and Magic,'' a gala art show of handcrafted wall hangings by Mariette Van Hees-Theeuwes of Randolph, a Dutch-born artist. Through June. Hours: Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 1225 Sussex Turnpike, Randolph. (973) 895-2661.

EXTENSION GALLERY -- Joseph W. Acquah's ''Dream Fulfilled, to God Be the Glory.'' Through June 29. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 60 Ward Avenue Extension, Mercerville. (609) 890-7777.

GALLERY OF SOUTH ORANGE -- ''Suspended Animation,'' steel and bronze sculptures by Wendy Klemperer; ''Aspect of the Female Experience,'' concrete sculptures by Barbara Lubliner; ''Theater of the Moon,'' assemblages by Kimberly Maier. Through July 30. Opening reception: today, 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and 4 to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Baird Center, 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE -- ''Spring Exhibition'' featuring Red Grooms: sculpture; Bill Barrett: sculpture and painting; and Andrzej Pitynski: partisans. Through July 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.

GUILD OF CREATIVE ART -- ''From F-8 to Beyond Nature,'' exhibition of digitally processed images by Alan Leckner and Dankwart Koehler, photographers. Through July 6. Hours: daily, noon to 4:30 p.m. 620 Broad Street, Shrewsbury. (732) 741-1441.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART -- ''Robert Forman: 'Narratives in Thread' and 'Huichol Art in the Collection of Robert Forman.' '' Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesday through Sunday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES -- ''Textures,'' a collection of fine art photography by Cosimo Scianna. Through June 28. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM -- ''The Prints of a Sculptor,'' by Melvin Edwards. Wednesday through Oct. 7 Opening reception: Wednesday, 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.

JOHNSON & JOHNSON HEADQUARTERS GALLERY -- ''Windows and Beyond,'' exhibition of oil paintings by Sue Ellen Rohrer Leys. Through July 5. Call for appointment only. 1 Johnson and Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick. (732) 524-6957.

LIBERTY SCIENCE CENTER -- ''Lakota Wolf Preserve,'' photographs by Dan Bacon. Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 9:30 to 5:30 p.m. Environment Level, Liberty State Park, 251 Phillip Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-0006, extension 295.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM -- ''Woven Into Words: Coverlets in America.'' Through Aug. 13. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.

MONMOUTH COUNTY HISTORICAL ASSOCIATION -- ''Angels in the Household: Childhood Life in Monmouth County, 1700-1920.'' Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $2; $1.50 for older people; $1 for those ages 6 to 18; free for children under 6. 70 Court Street, Freehold. (732) 462-1466.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM -- ''New Jersey's Pinelands: Water in the Balance.'' Through Sept. 3. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $4. 761 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM -- ''Untamed Spirits: Animal Imagery in Native American Art.'' Through July 30. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY -- David Cole: Recent Work and In Gathering of Paint Stirrers. Through July 21. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. University Gallery, Life Hall, Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-7640.

MORRIS COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY -- ''1900,'' exhibit of photos, products and objects. Through Sept. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; $2 for students. Acorn Hall, 68 Morris Avenue, Morristown. (973) 267-3465.

MORRIS MUSEUM -- ''Ice Age,'' featuring casts of mammals from the Pleistocene epoch. Through next Sunday. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN HUNGARIAN FOUNDATION -- ''Munkacsy in America,'' paintings by Mihaly Munkacsy. Through next Sunday. Donation: $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 300 Somerset Street, New Brunswick. (732) 846-5777.

NABISCO GALLERY -- ''Windows on My World,'' exhibit showcasing acrylic paintings, computer art and sculpture by students in the Arts Access program of the Matheny School and Hospital, Peapack. Through June 21. Reception: today, 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: daily, noon to 4 p.m. 100 DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (973) 503-2000.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY -- ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through July. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer, 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through Summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM -- ''Forgotten Gateway: The Abandoned Building of Ellis Island,'' photographs by Larry Racioppo. Through June 30. ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM -- ''The Art of Ink in American 2000: International Contemporary Calligraphy.'' Through July 9. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''From Tabletop to TV Tray: China and Glass in America, 1880-1980.'' Through next Sunday. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART -- Inspired by Nature series, featuring ''Recreating Flowers: The Glass Wonders of Paul J. Stankard.'' Through Sept. 3 ''Capturing the Jersey Shore: Works of Anthony J. Rudisill.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

OCEAN COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY -- ''Ocean County From the Explorers to 1950,'' featuring photographs, documents, paintings and objects illustrating the county's history. Through Oct. 31. Hours: Tuesdays and Thursdays, 1 to 3 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. 26 Hadley Avenue, Toms River. (732) 341-1880.

OLD CHURCH CULTURAL CENTER -- Exhibition of sculpture by Jong Sook Kang and Heyung Bok Lee, Korean artists. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 561 Piermont Road, Demarest. (201) 767-7160.

PASSAIC COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE -- Jessica Fromm: Recent Work. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Broadway and LRC Galleries, Broadway and Memorial Drive, Paterson. (973) 684-5448.
PETERS VALLEY CRAFT EDUCATION CENTER -- ''Art in the Open: The Peters Valley Gallery Without Walls.'' Through June 30. Group exhibition. 19 Kuhn Road, Layton. (973) 948-5200.
